subject: Re: Digital Voice Recorder Advice
author: mllejade
full_text:
Hi Deb,

Sorry to hear you were ill at The Stanley conference.  I, too, was at 
The Stanley when Mark Macy spoke there; afterwards he took polaroid 
photos of us with the luminator.  The photos were interesting; some 
of them looked like mere double exposures, others did show what could 
be the superimposition of another face from another dimension. I'm 
new to visual ITC, so the jury's out on this one for now!

Sharon

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Debbie Tejada <debbie@...> wrote:
>
> Wow, I'm loving all this information, it's giving me a lot of 
ideas.  
> Very exciting for me!
> 
> Does Mark Macy belong to this forum too? I met him about 3 years 
ago.  
> My husband is a commercial photographer and Mark asked him to do 
his  
> portrait for a book he was coming out with. He came to our home 
studio  
> for the portrait, and I got to talk with him a little about what 
he  
> does. At that time all I knew of EVP was from the White Noise 
movie,  
> wasn't sure it was real. But Mark was very nice, passionate about 
ITC/ 
> EVP and very convincing. I wasn't quite sure what to expect when I  
> originally heard what he did, with all the loonies out there 
claiming  
> all kinds of stuff, but I got a really good feeling from him and 
he's  
> very, well, like I said, convincing. After that I went to his web 
site  
> and also bought one of his books, which was a nice read.
> 
> I went to the Stanley Hotel in November with a ghost hunting group 
and
> Mark was a speaker there. I was really looking forward to his 
lecture,  
> but ended up with a wicked stomach virus and had to come home 
early. I  
> missed just about everything that weekend!
> 
> Deb T

> > Again, Mark Macy is so wonderful because he has dedicated his

right

been  
> > gradually growing since the 19th century, when state-of-the-art  
> > graphite pencils and telegraphs were used to contact the dead.   
> > Since then, there have been "breakthroughs" a number of times 
when  
> > astounding floods of messages have come through.
> > You experimenters are all so incredible--I'm amazed every day at  
> > your love, dedication and faith.  Surely something wonderful is  
> > going to come from all this, and I think it's going to come 
during  
> > our lifetimes.
